system.biography:
TitleFFF 206-3 Hunter Bujoc
Birthday18 Halane 699
AppearanceAge 20, height 5’ 8”, light frame, weight 138 lbs, attractive appearance, medium complexion, black hair, blue eyes
Medical/PsycheScars on right shoulder, chest and back from a bear attack
Size6
ArmorLeather knee boots and leggings, cloth shirt, mail byrnie, cloth tunic belted over the mail, cloth cloak. Dagger in boot, shortsword, short bow with quiver and 12 arrows. Add extra quiver & arrows, buckler and spear while travelling or if combat is expected.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables14d in silver in a money pouch
Notes

Biography

A Bujoc Sha woman raised Kit’tiara, but she never felt like she really belonged among the Bujoc. Her totem was a strange symbol carved into stone rather than the normal wooden animal icon. When she was 16, her mother revealed to her that she had not been born among the Bujoc. She was found with a dying woman in the Northern Anadels near Telumar. The woman had an advanced case of infection from a gargun arrow imbedded in her leg. She died holding Kit’tiara in one arm and clutching the amulet Kit’tiara now wears in the other hand.

Despite Bujoc beliefs that foreswear metal weapons, her adoptive mother stored the dead woman’s effects in a small dry cave. After revealing to Kit’tiara that she had not been born Bujoc, she showed her adopted daughter the dagger, broken short sword and mail byrnie owned by her real mother. Kit’tiara left the effects in the cave.

In the fall of 718, Kit’tiara encountered a group of fo eigners camping in the Anadels. One of them, an unusually tall woman, had many items engraved with symbols similar to the one on her amulet. Intrigued by this, Kit’tiara followed them. Three days later, she discovered a group of Chindra gargun preparing to attack the strangers. Kit’tiara decided to warn them. Rather than flee as the Bujoc normally do, the foreigners decided to investigate and attacked the gargun. Watching the fight, Kit’tiara became convinced that she did not belong with the Bujoc. She also came to understand the nature of metal – it provided you a means to fight evil. With metal, you did not have to run and hide.

After she left the foreigners, Kit’tiara retrieved her mother’s effects. When she returned, she formally introduced herself and asked the tall woman what the symbol on her amulet meant. Since then, the group has made her welcome, gifted her with a new sword, helped her restore her mother’s armour and dagger to pristine condition, and shown her that the world is a much larger, far more complicated place than the Anadel Highlands.

Adventure Hooks

Tracker: PCs are on the trail of someone and need an experienced tracker to help them. Conversely, the PCs are being hunted, and Kit’tiara is hired to track them.

The Warning: The PCs are travelling, Kit’tiara suddenly appears out of the woods and warns them of an ambush or a dangerous beast.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
